conclusion: The work done by the gas from state B to state C can be calculated by finding the area under the p-V curve between these two states.
From the image, the pressure at state B is 2 x 10^5 Pa and at state C is 1 x 10^5 Pa. The volume at state B is 2 x 10^-3 m^3 and at state C is 3 x 10^-3 m^3.

The work done is given by the area of the trapezoid formed by these points. The area of a trapezoid is given by (1/2) * (base1 + base2) * height, where base1 and base2 are the lengths of the parallel sides and height is the perpendicular distance between them.
Here, base1 is the pressure at state B (2 x 10^5 Pa), base2 is the pressure at state C (1 x 10^5 Pa), and height is the change in volume (3 x 10^-3 m^3 - 2 x 10^-3 m^3 = 1 x 10^-3 m^3).
Therefore, the work done by the gas from state B to state C is 150 J.
